org.streaminer.stream.cardinality

Class HyperLogLogPlus

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.cardinality.HyperLogLogPlus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICardinality

    public class HyperLogLogPlus
extends Object
implements ICardinality
    Implementation of HyperLogLog++ described in

    http://static.googleusercontent.com/external_content/untrusted_dlcp/research.google.com/en/us/pubs/archive/40671.pdf

    Brief HyperLogLog++ Overview

    Uses 64 bit hashing instead of 32 Has two representation modes: sparse and normal

    'normal' is approximately the same as regular hyperloglog (still uses 64 bits)

    'sparse' handles lower cardinality values with a highly accurate but poorly scaling strategy and leverages data compression to compete with 'normal' for as long as possible (sparse has the advantage on accuracy per unit of memory at low cardinality but quickly falls behind).

    • Constructor Detail

      • HyperLogLogPlus

        public HyperLogLogPlus(int p)
        This constructor disables the sparse set. If the counter is likely to exceed the sparse set thresholds than using this constructor will help avoid the extra memory pressure created by maintaining the sparse set until that threshold is breached.
        Parameters:
        p - The precision value for the normal set

      • HyperLogLogPlus

        public HyperLogLogPlus(int p,
               int sp)
        Basic constructor for creating a instance that supports sparse and normal representations. The values of p and sp define the precision of the Normal and Sparse set representations for the data structure. p must be a value between 4 and sp and sp must be less than 32.
        Parameters:
        p - The precision value for the normal set
        sp - The precision value for the sparse set

      • HyperLogLogPlus

        public HyperLogLogPlus(int p,
               int sp,
               List<byte[]> deltaByteSet)
        Constructor to support instances serialized with the legacy sparse encoding scheme.
        Parameters:
        p - The precision value for the normal set
        sp - The precision value for the sparse set
        deltaByteSet - A list of varint byte arrays encoded using a delta encoding scheme

      • cardinality

        public long cardinality()
        Gather the cardinality estimate from this estimator.

        Has two procedures based on current mode. 'Normal' mode works similar to HLL but has some new bias corrections. 'Sparse' mode is linear counting.

        Specified by:
        cardinality in interface ICardinality
        Returns:

      • mergeTempList

        protected void mergeTempList()
        Script-esque function that handles preparing to and executing merging the sparse set and the temp list.

        Set up the delta encoding, sort the temp list, merge the lists, blow up the temp list. Exposed for testing purposes

      • sortEncodedSet

        public int[] sortEncodedSet(int[] encodedSet,
                   int validIndex)

      • addAll

        public void addAll(HyperLogLogPlus other)
            throws HyperLogLogPlus.HyperLogLogPlusMergeException
        Add all the elements of the other set to this set. If possible, the sparse mode is protected. A switch to the normal mode is triggered only if the resulting set exceed the threshold. This operation does not imply a loss of precision.
        Parameters:
        other - A compatible Hyperloglog++ instance (same p and sp)
        Throws:
        HyperLogLogPlus.HyperLogLogPlusMergeException - if other is not compatible

      • merge

        public ICardinality merge(ICardinality... estimators)
                   throws CardinalityMergeException
        Merge this HLL++ with a bunch of others! The power of minions!

        Most of the logic consists of case analysis about the state of this HLL++ and each one it wants to merge with. If either of them is 'normal' mode then the other converts to 'normal' as well. A touching sacrifice. 'Normal's combine just like regular HLL estimators do.

        If they happen to be both sparse, then it checks if their combined size would be too large and if so, they get relegated to normal mode anyway. Otherwise, the mergeEstimators function is called, and a new sparse HLL++ is born.

        Specified by:
        merge in interface ICardinality
        Parameters:
        estimators - the estimators to merge with this one
        Returns:
        a new estimator with their combined knowledge
        Throws:
        CardinalityMergeException
